snippet: The N.H.L. has formed a partnership with a gay advocacy group to plan training and counseling on gay issues, and the N.F.L. is looking to smooth the way for acceptance.
abstract: Four major professional sports leagues in the United States, with growing expectations that gay male athlete will soon come out publicly for first time, are exploring ways to accommodate and respond to announcement; National Hockey League forms partnership with gay advocacy group to plan training and counseling on gay issues, and National Football League is looking to smooth the way for acceptance.

byline.original: By JEFF Z. KLEIN and JUDY BATTISTA

lead_paragraph: The N.H.L. has formed a partnership with a gay advocacy group to plan training and counseling on gay issues, and the N.F.L. is looking to smooth the way for acceptance.

headline.seo: Major Pro Leagues Prepare for the ‘I’m Gay’ Announcement
headline.main: Major Sports Leagues Prepare for the ‘I’m Gay’ Disclosure
